page.title: 11FARMING IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: MACHINERY. In Fylingdales the small farms have about 60 acres. The bigger farms have about 200 acres and the largest farms about 350 acres. All our local farms have at least two or three tractors. Over the years they have become bigger and more powerful so they can pull heavy machinery. It is hard land to farm because of the deep valleys and the close proximity to the moors. The farmers have different kinds of machinery, to prepare the soil, plant and harvest crops, to dig ditches and cut the hedgerows, to make silage and hay, to spread fertilizers and control weeds and pests. They also have trailers to carry crops and hay, elevators and milking machines which all help the farmer.
